snippet: In the midst of the 2008 financial crisis, Timothy F. Geithner, now the United States Treasury secretary, saw problems with the process for setting key interest rates and raised concerns with his counterparts in London about Libor.
abstract: In the midst of the 2008 financial crisis, Timothy F. Geithner, now the United States Treasury secretary, saw problems with the process for setting key interest rates and raised concerns with his counterparts in London about Libor.

headline.main: Geithner Tried to Curb Rate Rigging in 2008
headline.print_headline: Geithner Tried to Curb Bank’s Rate Rigging in 2008
